titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2020.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2022 August 8.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-05-17 13:14:17 -0700.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Larry Harmon started the independent Genetic Disorder zine in 1987. Harmon's zine included detailed researching and reporting of the odd tales of Southern California. Harmon participated in the Kill Zinesters Summer Vacation Tour of 1996 with Darby Romeo of Ben Is Dead and Noel Tolentino of Bunnyhop among other zinesters. The Larry Harmon zine collection ranges from 1984-2018 and contains Harmon's collection of zines, including issues of his own zine Genetic Disorder.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Larry and JoAnna Harmon, 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Larry Harmon zine collection (Collection 2376). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Kelly Besser with assistance from Tess Livesley-O'Neill in 2020.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Larry Harmon started the independent Genetic Disorder zine in 1987. Harmon's zine included detailed researching and reporting of the odd tales of Southern California. Harmon participated in the Kill Zinesters Summer Vacation Tour of 1996 with Darby Romeo of Ben Is Dead and Noel Tolentino of Bunnyhop among other zinesters.

Whiting, Ben. "The Zine Scene / Indie publishers of alternative periodicals hit the road to increase their visibility." SFGate, June 30, 1996. https://www.sfgate.com/entertainment/article/The-Zine-Scene-Indie-publishers-of-alternative-2976798.php.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Larry Harmon zine collection ranges from 1984-2018 and contains Harmon's collection of zines, including issues of his own zine Genetic Disorder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by the title of the zine and chronologically within titles.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Darby Romeo Collection of Zines (Collection 1746). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.
